title: CryptSafe
author: CryptSafe
content: Hello Ladies and Gentlemen,This is my first time of uploading my message content for the forum to see. I have to do it for every necessary measures to be taken to forestall any ill activities of this account holder.As  at 7th of June 2023 as clearly seen on the uploaded image, the user as also seen (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3541801) sent me a message which I suspected to be a scam. I had to run a check and discovered that he the sender profile is kind of scanty with registration date March 17, 2023, 03:48:03 AM and since then @proxy3200 has not made any post not to talk of replying any post. I do not know how many people here must have received such message. I just want to let the platform know about this so that nobody would fall for this trick by this account holder @proxy3200.If they are looking for this services what stops them from making an official announcement on the service board for others to see rather than sending message to my dm if they do not have a sinister motive. I would advise anyone dealing with them to be extremely cautious

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: With sending personal message to you (and probably some other users) and advertising his/her service, the user in question broke rule number 29. Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM29. Sending unsolicited PMs, including but not limited to advertising and flood, is not allowed.Report the message you received to admins. He/she will be probably banned.

comments.author: rby
comments.body: I don't know if proxy3200 has been nuked already because I checked their profile and met zero activity, post and merit. It is very unlikely that someone who hasn't dropped a single post on the forum will go ahead to pm random people, unless they are scammer. Even at that, a scammer should atleast make themselves somewhat believeable.Op, consider to active the function that prevents newbies to message you and be safe.Meanwhile, I have gotten some random messages from people who wants me to promote their project via my signature and then, they don't have any Ann thread and that doesn't imply they are scammers.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.created_time: June 08, 2023, 07:11:56 PMLast edit: June 08, 2023, 07:25:50 PM by hosseinimr93
comments.body: Quote from: rby on June 08, 2023, 06:09:12 PMI don't know if proxy3200 has been nuked already because I checked their profile and met zero activity, post and merit. The user hasn't been banned. It would be reported on BPIP if he\she had been banned. According to loyce.club, the user had made 1 post which has been deleted by moderators. It seems that the user has registered the account only for advertising purposes.

comments.author: rby
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on June 08, 2023, 07:11:56 PMIt seems the user has registered the account only for advertising purposes. You are correct. The account is only for advertising purposes but s/he is not doing it the right way. I doubt they will last longer than this before they will be banned.The account is promoting a service he passed a disclaimer onQuoteI am not the owner of this script I am just a reseller. Use this at your own riskYet, he is taking it to PM. Such projects should be promoted on a neutral ground.However, little insight in the script showed it's a scam.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: In the only post that he created and was deleted by the mods, he was claiming to sell BC.game scriptsQuote from: https://ninjastic.space/post/62033099New British Columbia.BC.Game The Crash game hacking script is designed to multiply your cryptocurrency funds by creating successful bets on the Crash game. This bot is smart and advanced, let it work automatically, and it will bring you moneyRequirements:Windows/LinuxGoogle ChromeSetupOpen your new BC.Game account.Deposit funds or buy a few BFG Tokens.Open your browser console and Paste the BOT code.Run and let it work while you multiply your cryptocurrencybc.game, BC.Game Bot Hack, BC.Game Hack Scripts, BC.Game ScriptsBuy Now: https://suspiciouslinkHe could actually be trying to spread malware for all we know. Hope the account gets nuked if he persists.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: When you receive such messages in the future, all you have to do is report them and delete the message after reporting them. Those accounts will be banned, especially if it is a newbie account (less than 16 or 30 activity)I receive many of these messages and rarely read them but what I have learned is that there is a pattern in your posts that made them feel like you could be a victim of scam.

comments.author: Z_MBFM
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on June 09, 2023, 07:03:12 AMWhen you receive such messages in the future, all you have to do is report them and delete the message after reporting them. Those accounts will be banned, especially if it is a newbie account (less than 16 or 30 activity)I receive many of these messages and rarely read them but what I have learned is that there is a pattern in your posts that made them feel like you could be a victim of scam.If op get such messages, it is better to delete them. and report is required before deletion. However, since the account is brand new and has no activity, this account may not be banned due to the report. But op can stop receiving messages from Newbie to avoid such spamming. he/she can just follow the step bellow PROFILE =>Personal Message Options => disable, Allow newbies to send you PMs =>change profile That would be a good thing. Because most of the spamming is done through newbie accounts

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Z_MBFM on June 09, 2023, 10:49:56 AMPROFILE =>Personal Message Options => disable, Allow newbies to send you PMs =>change profile That would be a good thing. Because most of the spamming is done through newbie accountsProblem will be, you will miss to communicate with legit users who are newbie but need your help. The type of PM OP received are very common on the forum and you do not need to be an expert to understand what they want from these PMs. Just delete it or report it to the admin or ignore.Don't need to make it a big deal.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on June 09, 2023, 09:24:42 PMQuote from: Z_MBFM on June 09, 2023, 10:49:56 AMPROFILE =>Personal Message Options => disable, Allow newbies to send you PMs =>change profile That would be a good thing. Because most of the spamming is done through newbie accountsProblem will be, you will miss to communicate with legit users who are newbie but need your help. The type of PM OP received are very common on the forum and you do not need to be an expert to understand what they want from these PMs. Just delete it or report it to the admin or ignore.Don't need to make it a big deal.It is not a big deal but taking precautionary measures is very important.  I have had this experience of this similar thing in the past so my posting it here was just to  let the platform know. I do not really know if other people have received this type of message from this particular profile but atleast people who have seen this post are now aware of this profile and the unsolicited spam messages the account profile sends spamming members privacy.Although it is on the safe side I take precautionary measures to safeguard my account and reputation but that shouldn't be a thing to worry about.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: CryptSafe on June 09, 2023, 10:49:14 PMAlthough it is on the safe side I take precautionary measures to safeguard my account and reputation but that shouldn't be a thing to worry about.The precautionary measures are already given by the system in red large font.Quote!!! WARNING: This use is a newbie. If you are expecting a message from a more veteran member, then this is an imposter !!!Ans you can stop the users activity just by reporting it to the admin as suggested by others and me as well in my earlier posts.

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Quote from: CryptSafe on June 08, 2023, 04:07:46 PMI do not know how many people here must have received such message. I just want to let the platform know about this so that nobody would fall for this trick by this account holder @proxy3200. Probably not many users received a message from him since he is a newbie and has a PM restriction due to his rank. Since his rank is a newbie with zero activity, he won't be able to send more than two PMs daily.Quote from: theymos on December 06, 2017, 07:35:30 PMActivityMax recipientsMax recipients if whitelistedMax PMs per hourMax PMs per hour if whitelistedMax PMs per dayMax PMs per day if whitelisted02101402120QuoteIf they are looking for this services what stops them from making an official announcement on the service board for others to see rather than sending message to my dm if they do not have a sinister motive. I would advise anyone dealing with them to be extremely cautious This is a scam attempt, for sure. Why do they try to sell those scripts if such scripts work? They can make unlimited money by using thewn scripts and not selling them. Here this guy tried to exchange a script. Who knows, maybe his scripts contain malicious codes that can harm your computer, and you might get hacked.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: Learn Bitcoin on June 10, 2023, 01:44:17 PMQuote from: CryptSafe on June 08, 2023, 04:07:46 PMI do not know how many people here must have received such message. I just want to let the platform know about this so that nobody would fall for this trick by this account holder @proxy3200. Probably not many users received a message from him since he is a newbie and has a PM restriction due to his rank. Since his rank is a newbie with zero activity, he won't be able to send more than two PMs daily.QuoteIf they are looking for this services what stops them from making an official announcement on the service board for others to see rather than sending message to my dm if they do not have a sinister motive. I would advise anyone dealing with them to be extremely cautious This is a scam attempt, for sure. Why do they try to sell those scripts if such scripts work? They can make unlimited money by using thewn scripts and not selling them. Here this guy tried to exchange a script. Who knows, maybe his scripts contain malicious codes that can harm your computer, and you might get hacked. I thought as much too because I see no reason why one would want to sell such script when in the real sense one could get a fortune out of it then I realized there is more to it than I thought. Possibly, there could be something more to this script than we could think of. Maybe just a you have said the possibility of it being  coded for some nefarious act and these scammers do pick possible targets so as to infiltrate their devices with virus with codes if their targets do buy or exchange script with them.

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on June 09, 2023, 09:24:42 PMQuote from: Z_MBFM on June 09, 2023, 10:49:56 AMPROFILE =>Personal Message Options => disable, Allow newbies to send you PMs =>change profile That would be a good thing. Because most of the spamming is done through newbie accountsProblem will be, you will miss to communicate with legit users who are newbie but need your help. The type of PM OP received are very common on the forum and you do not need to be an expert to understand what they want from these PMs. Just delete it or report it to the admin or ignore.Don't need to make it a big deal.That's it. You can't eat your cake and have it.Thought it might solve one issue, it would as well prevent them newbie accounts that could have come with some good intell. Perhaps they could buy  a copper membership but, not many are into doing that. Probably because they won't see the need or just aren't aware.Still, treating these suspicious users case by case won't be so bad. You just be mindful of what messages you ply into just like the OP. You do your research both on the offers and the individual to have sent the pm. Taking into account not to have your greed lead you. It's always there to make you fall.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Z_MBFM on June 09, 2023, 10:49:56 AMQuote from: hugeblack on June 09, 2023, 07:03:12 AMWhen you receive such messages in the future, all you have to do is report them and delete the message after reporting them. Those accounts will be banned, especially if it is a newbie account (less than 16 or 30 activity)I receive many of these messages and rarely read them but what I have learned is that there is a pattern in your posts that made them feel like you could be a victim of scam.If op get such messages, it is better to delete them. and report is required before deletion. However, since the account is brand new and has no activity, this account may not be banned due to the report. But op can stop receiving messages from Newbie to avoid such spamming. he/she can just follow the step bellow PROFILE =>Personal Message Options => disable, Allow newbies to send you PMs =>change profile That would be a good thing. Because most of the spamming is done through newbie accountsI will also go by this option because it's one of the perfect measures to silent all forms of distractions like this in receiving PMs, some of them could be as annoying as anything, for those that sees a need to taking such decision there's no problem, but we also may consider not taking this action because of those involved in rendering their  services through the forum platforms and their patronages may simply comes through newbie accounts for their offer, but if you don't have any reason to enable receiving messages from newbies then one can go ahead to disallow that.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: @CryptSafeDo you think there might be a reason why the person PMed you about these scripts and not one of the thousands of other users of Bitcointalk? Have you ever posted on the forum that you would be interested in buying or exchanging those scripts with someone?If not and it's completely random, there is surely a nefarious reason behind the offer. Report, delete, and don't look back.

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on June 17, 2023, 12:38:53 PM@CryptSafeDo you think there might be a reason why the person PMed you about these scripts and not one of the thousands of other users of Bitcointalk? Have you ever posted on the forum that you would be interested in buying or exchanging those scripts with someone?If not and it's completely random, there is surely a nefarious reason behind the offer. Report, delete, and don't look back.They targeted most gambling board active posters who normally post on the casino ANN, I have identical messages in my inbox but from different accounts so I'm guessing he's the same person, got nuked and create new account to continue.

comments.author: CYBER_COWBOY
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on June 08, 2023, 04:18:42 PMWith sending personal message to you (and probably some other users) and advertising his/her service, the user in question broke rule number 29. Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM29. Sending unsolicited PMs, including but not limited to advertising and flood, is not allowed.Report the message you received to admins. He/she will be probably banned. Is it not legal do advertise in PM?I also got advertising in PM. But from another user.Then I should report it to.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: CYBER_COWBOY on June 19, 2023, 07:24:06 PMQuote from: hosseinimr93 on June 08, 2023, 04:18:42 PMWith sending personal message to you (and probably some other users) and advertising his/her service, the user in question broke rule number 29. Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM29. Sending unsolicited PMs, including but not limited to advertising and flood, is not allowed.Report the message you received to admins. He/she will be probably banned. Is it not legal do advertise in PM?I also got advertising in PM. But from another user.Then I should report it to.Yes, it's not legal or maybe acceptable here on this forum for a member to advertise a service through P.M if they don't have an ulterior motive, because any legit business will do an open advertisement on the "Service board" of the forum, and not hide under the shadow of the forum sending messages to random users looking for a possible victim that will likely far for their scam. So whenever you see such, you either report it here or ignore it, which someone earlier suggested.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on June 17, 2023, 12:38:53 PMDo you think there might be a reason why the person PMed you about these scripts and not one of the thousands of other users of Bitcointalk? Have you ever posted on the forum that you would be interested in buying or exchanging those scripts with someone?It mostly happens when you reply to a certain thread or service thread of the person. I also received an unsolicited PM from one of the newbie accounts and in their service thread I had just a few suggestions concerning their websiteI don't know why they thought that I would be interested in buying their script, especially given the fact that they have negative feedback about trying to buy forum accountsQuote from: CYBER_COWBOY on June 19, 2023, 07:24:06 PMIs it not legal do advertise in PM?I also got advertising in PM. But from another user.Then I should report it to.Let me guess, is this the guyReport any unsolicited PMs
